body.p: As an on-premise desktop application, does not store sensitive user data or user-specific files on remote servers. The full Privacy Policy is available on the official web site.

Whenever it is started, the application may connect to its official web site (https://www.oxygenxml.com) in order to provide notifications about new releases or new events. In the Preferences Global page there are a number of checkboxes which can be used to disable if needed this type of connections:
Automatic Version Checking To obtain information about new available versions from the official web site the application provides the license category (academic/professional/enterprise), the product version, Java version and operating system name.
Check for Oxygen-related events at startup No specific information about the current installation is passed to the web site when the application obtains information about events which gets displayed in the Welcome screen. The types of downloaded events include information about the addition of new videos on the website, announcements of upcoming webinars and conferences where the team will participate, and more.
Check for Oxygen-related notifications No specific information about the current installation is passed to the web site when the application obtains information about other various notifications which get displayed on the right side of the status bar.

Providing installation-specific details to the technical support team is also possible by using the main menu Help Report problem action. Also, if an unhandled/fatal error occurs in the application, the user is presented with a Report problem dialog and can choose to submit the error and its context for analysis The Report problem dialog shows exactly the specific details which are sent to the technical support team and can be examined by the end user before being sent. No files or confidential information are sent.

When the application is installed on Windows or Linux using the provided installation kit the last installation step allows clicking a Privacy Options link in order to choose exactly what privacy-related settings should be disabled before the application starts for the first time. The Privacy Options can also be disabled when performing an unattended install. See instructions here: .
